etymology.description: 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow bird") + 麦(麥) (mài, "wheat; grain") — swallow bird grain
etymology.interpretation: 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow bird") relates to the natural environment where oats can be found, as swallows are often seen in agricultural areas. 麦(麥) (mài, "grain") indicates that oats are a type of grain, linking the two parts into a meaningful compound referring to this specific food source.

parts.english: swallow bird; swallow (the bird); to smile; to chant
wheat; grain; to sell; to advise

examples.chinese: 早餐我通常吃燕麦粥(燕麥粥)。
examples.pinyin: zǎo cān wǒ tōng cháng chī yàn mài zhōu。
examples.english: For breakfast, I usually eat oats porridge.

examples.chinese: 燕麦(燕麥)是一种有营养的食品。
examples.pinyin: yàn mài (yàn mài) shì yī zhǒng yǒu yíng yǎng de shī pǐn。

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用燕麦(燕麥)制作健康的小吃。
examples.pinyin: wǒ xǐ huān yòng yàn mài (yàn mài) zhì zuò jiàn kāng de xiǎo chī。
examples.english: I like to make healthy snacks using oats.
